items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Bend your right elbow and bring it up to shoulder height, keeping your forearm parallel to the ground.
Place your left hand on your right elbow and gently pull it across your chest towards your left shoulder.
Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling a stretch in your right shoulder and upper back.
Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.

content.title: Elbow Out Rotator Stretch Form & Visual

items: Helps to improve shoulder mobility and flexibility
Reduces the risk of shoulder injuries
Relieves tension and tightness in the shoulder muscles
Improves posture and alignment of the upper body
Can be done anywhere without any equipment

content.title: Elbow Out Rotator Stretch Muscles Worked

items: Rotator cuff muscles
Deltoid muscle
Teres major muscle
Infraspinatus muscle
Subscapularis muscle

content.title: Elbow Out Rotator Stretch Variations & Alternatives

items: Elbow In Rotator Stretch
Shoulder External Rotation with Resistance Band
Seated Shoulder External Rotation
Standing Shoulder External Rotation
Shoulder Internal Rotation with Resistance Band
Seated Shoulder Internal Rotation
Standing Shoulder Internal Rotation
